entries.source: Changing indexing settings will clear the cache, and requires a restart of Obsidian.
entries.translated: Changing indexing settings will clear the cache, and requires a restart of Obsidian.

entries.source: Omnisearch will use Text Extractor to index the content of your PDFs.
entries.translated: Omnisearch will use Text Extractor to index the content of your PDFs.

entries.source: Omnisearch will use Text Extractor to OCR your images and index their content.
entries.translated: Omnisearch will use Text Extractor to OCR your images and index their content.

entries.source: If both AI Image Analyzer and Text Extractor are enabled, Text Extractor will only be used as a fallback.
entries.translated: If both AI Image Analyzer and Text Extractor are enabled, Text Extractor will only be used as a fallback.

entries.source: Set frontmatter property key as title
entries.translated: Set frontmatter property key as title

entries.source: Using extensions of non-plaintext files (like .pptx) WILL cause crashes, because Omnisearch will try to index their content.
entries.translated: Using extensions of non-plaintext files (like .pptx) WILL cause crashes, because Omnisearch will try to index their content.

entries.source: Enable caching to speed up indexing time. In rare cases, the cache write may cause a crash in Obsidian. This option will disable itself if it happens.
entries.translated: Enable caching to speed up indexing time. In rare cases, the cache write may cause a crash in Obsidian. This option will disable itself if it happens.

entries.source: Re-executes the previous query when opening Omnisearch.
entries.translated: Re-executes the previous query when opening Omnisearch.

entries.source: By default, files that are in Obsidian's "Options > Files & Links > Excluded Files" list are downranked in results. Enable this option to completely hide them.
entries.translated: By default, files that are in Obsidian's "Options > Files & Links > Excluded Files" list are downranked in results. Enable this option to completely hide them.

entries.source: Folders to downrank in search results
entries.translated: Folders to downrank in search results

entries.source: Folders to downrank in search results. Files in these folders will be downranked in results. They will still be indexed for tags, unlike excluded files. Folders should be comma delimited.
entries.translated: Folders to downrank in search results. Files in these folders will be downranked in results. They will still be indexed for tags, unlike excluded files. Folders should be comma delimited.

entries.source: Changing this setting will clear the cache.
entries.translated: Changing this setting will clear the cache.

entries.source: Enable this if Obsidian often freezes while making searches. Words shorter than 3 characters won't be used as prefixes; this can reduce search delay but will return fewer results.
entries.translated: Enable this if Obsidian often freezes while making searches. Words shorter than 3 characters won't be used as prefixes; this can reduce search delay but will return fewer results.

entries.source: Enable this if you want to be able to search for URLs as separate words. This setting has a strong impact on indexing performance, and can crash Obsidian under certain conditions.
entries.translated: Enable this if you want to be able to search for URLs as separate words. This setting has a strong impact on indexing performance, and can crash Obsidian under certain conditions.

entries.source: Open and create files in a new pane instead of the current pane.
entries.translated: Open and create files in a new pane instead of the current pane.

entries.source: Navigate down the results with Ctrl + J/N, or navigate up with Ctrl + K/P.
entries.translated: Navigate down the results with Ctrl + J/N, or navigate up with Ctrl + K/P.

entries.source: Define the level of fuzziness for the search. The higher the fuzziness, the more results you'll get.
entries.translated: Define the level of fuzziness for the search. The higher the fuzziness, the more results you'll get.

entries.source: Add a button on the sidebar to open the Vault search modal.
entries.translated: Add a button on the sidebar to open the Vault search modal.

entries.source: Shows the contextual part of the note that matches the search. Disable this to only show filenames in results.
entries.translated: Shows the contextual part of the note that matches the search. Disable this to only show filenames in results.

entries.source: Activate this option to render line returns in result excerpts.
entries.translated: Activate this option to render line returns in result excerpts.

entries.source: Will highlight matching results when enabled. See README for more customization options.
entries.translated: Will highlight matching results when enabled. See README for more customization options.

entries.source: You can set custom weights for values of header properties (e.g. "keywords"). Weights under 1.0 will downrank the results.
entries.translated: You can set custom weights for values of header properties (e.g. "keywords"). Weights under 1.0 will downrank the results.

entries.source: Files that have been modified more recently than [selected cutoff] are given a higher rank.
entries.translated: Files that have been modified more recently than [selected cutoff] are given a higher rank.

entries.source: Show a notification when the server starts
entries.translated: Show a notification when the server starts

entries.source: Will display a notification if the server is enabled, at Obsidian startup.
entries.translated: Will display a notification if the server is enabled, at Obsidian startup.

entries.source: Enabling this setting could lead to crash loops
entries.translated: Enabling this setting could lead to crash loops

entries.source: Adds a LOT of logs for debugging purposes. You also need to enable "Verbose" logging in the console to see these logs.
entries.translated: Adds a LOT of logs for debugging purposes. You also need to enable "Verbose" logging in the console to see these logs.
